item.title: Report E-2024070062
item.description:
Report E-2024070062

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately 25-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM identified the impacted areas of trailer that would need to be power washed and moved the trailer to the R+L washing station. The crew removed as much pigment from the paint as they could and moved onto power wash the pavement that was impacted. The total waste resulted in 2 drums of waste and one over pack for the damaged container.

item.title: Report E-2024070040
item.description:
Report E-2024070040

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to improper loading or bracing. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris and released material. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061703
item.description:
Report X-2024061703

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: I have seen the same shipment come through and leak 3 times now. Zep Purple Degreaser, a Corrosive Hazmat, has leaked multiple times. All thanks to the caps coming loose. Can someone, please, reach out to the shipper and ask them to do something about this? Tape over the lids, a plastic bag, anything that helps prevent this from happening again.
